metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5816 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow error within the "identify()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.12 can be exploited to trigger a division by zero via specially crafted NOKIARAW file (Note: This vulnerability is caused due to an incomplete fix of CVE-2018-5804).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> Issue caused by an incomplete fix for CVE-2018-5804

criterions.comment: darktable package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1ubuntu0.4').
rawtherapee package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
ufraw package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
